data.title: CommQuest Welcomes New Board Members
data.meta_description: CommQuest Services is excited to announce the addition of three new members to our Board of Directors. Jeff Dafler is a well-renowned public affairs executive who has more than 25 […]
data.text:
CommQuest Services is excited to announce the addition of three new members to our Board of Directors.

Jeff Dafler is a well-renowned public affairs executive who has more than 25 years experience in the public and private sectors. Dafler is currently the founder and chief strategist for the Dafler Company, where he assists clients with public policy advocacy, communication, and strategy.

Before the Dafler Company, Jeff was the Vice President of Government Affairs for the Timken Company. In this role, he was tasked with building relationships with government officials globally and engaging them in dialogue to better understand how social, environmental, and economic priorities in various parts of the world intersected with the Timken Company’s capabilities and goals.

Jeff holds bachelor’s degrees in international studies and French from Miami University and a master’s degree in communication from the University of Dayton. He serves as adjunct faculty in the Communications Department at Walsh University and has published academic research in the areas of communication, identity, and organizational behavior.

Roger Duffy is a Financial Advisor at a large financial services organization. His practice consists of advising individuals and families on strategies and programs available to help them reach their financial goals.

Before his Financial work, Roger played 12 seasons in the National Football League as an Offensive Lineman. His extensive career included stints playing for the New York Jets and Pittsburgh Steelers. Roger and his wife, Cathy, have three children and reside in Canton, Ohio.

Roger formerly served as a Community Services of Stark County Board Member from 2010-2015, and then as a CommQuest Services Board Member from 2015-2018.

Dr. Brock Reiman has worked in higher education since 1985 as a professor and administrator. Currently, Reiman serves as the Vice President for Academic Affairs at Indiana Wesleyan University for the College of Adult and Professional Studies. In this role, he oversees four academic units that serve nearly 8,000 students every year.

Prior to IWU, Dr. Reiman served as a leader at Malone University in various positions including Director of Campus Counseling Center, Chair for Graduate Counseling, Chair for Psychology, and Associate Dean of Graduate Studies, among several other positions.

Dr. Reiman has a BA in Psychology and Christian from Malone University, a Masters of Arts degree in Counseling and Human Development from Walsh University, and a Doctorate in Counseling and Human Development from Kent State University.
